title.rendered: OWC releases white paper – Ground Conditions of the Polish Baltic Sea

content.rendered:
Following OWC’s recent webinar on geohazards in the Polish Baltic Sea, we have released a white paper covering this topic.

Our geotechnical specialist Ana Isabel Pirrone undertook significant research into the geological conditions of the Polish Baltic Sea and summarised her findings in this white paper. Ana presented her findings in the webinar on November 5th, and the white paper is now available for free download. If you wish to discuss this market, please contact our Poland country manager Lukasz Sikorski. Click here to learn more about our geotechnical services.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC advises on geohazards for Polish offshore wind
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC has identified significant geohazards that developers should address following a study of the geological conditions of the Polish sector of the Baltic Sea.   “We have identified numerous key potential geohazards such as boulders, shallow gas, geological faults, chalk and lateral variability of the soil conditions with some bedrock…

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC to support Baltic Sea offshore wind projects
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Baltic Power, subsidiary of Polish energy company PKN Orlen, has retained offshore wind consultancy firm OWC as technical advisor to its 1.2 GW offshore wind development in the Baltic Sea.

jetpack-related-posts.title: INWED 2020 – Ana Isabel Pirrone
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Ana Pirrone is a Geotechnical Engineer in our London office, and her duties include involvement in offshore wind projects as the geotechnical specialist and carrying out & actively managing the Leg Penetrations Analyses.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC establishes office in Poland
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC continues its international expansion and sets up an office in Poland to support offshore wind developments in the Baltic Sea. Lukasz Sikorski has been appointed manager of the office.

jetpack-related-posts.title: OWC celebrates 1,500 LPAs / AB
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: OWC and AqualisBraemar have completed their 1,500th leg penetration assessment, which is conducted prior to deployment of jack-ups and wind turbine installation lift barges that are utilised at offshore wind farms and for oil and gas rig moves.

jetpack-related-posts.title: Webinar: September Marine Market Briefing
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Register now for our September Market Briefing Webinar for maritime & insurance professionals and join our experts who will be detailing first-hand experiences of our findings during ‘Shipshape©’ Risk Assessment Surveys.
